content:
SimpleWorkerRequest Class

Definition

Provides a simple implementation of the HttpWorkerRequest abstract class that can be used to host ASP.NET applications outside an Internet Information Services (IIS) application. You can employ SimpleWorkerRequest directly or extend it.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(false)]
public class SimpleWorkerRequest : System.Web.HttpWorkerRequest

System.Web.HttpWorkerRequest

Remarks

This simple implementation of HttpWorkerRequest provides the request URL and the query string and captures the body of the output into a TextWriter. To achieve richer functionality, such as providing posted content and headers and capturing the response headers or response body as binary data, you should extend SimpleWorkerRequest and override the appropriate HttpWorkerRequest methods.

Constructors

SimpleWorkerRequest(String,String,TextWriter)

Initializes a new instance of the SimpleWorkerRequest class when the target application domain has been created using the stem.Web.Hosting.ApplicationHost.CreateApplicationHost* method.

public SimpleWorkerRequest (string page, string query, System.IO.TextWriter output);
page
String

The page to be requested (or the virtual path to the page, relative to the application directory).

query
String

The text of the query string.

output
TextWriter

A TextWriter that captures output from the response

SimpleWorkerRequest(String,String,String,String,TextWriter)

Initializes a new instance of the SimpleWorkerRequest class for use in an arbitrary application domain, when the user code creates an HttpContext (passing the SimpleWorkerRequest as an argument to the HttpContext constructor).

public SimpleWorkerRequest (string appVirtualDir, string appPhysicalDir, string page, string query, System.IO.TextWriter output);
appVirtualDir
String

The virtual path to the application directory; for example, "/app".

appPhysicalDir
String

The physical path to the application directory; for example, "c:\app".

page
String

The virtual path for the request (relative to the application directory).

query
String

The text of the query string.

output
TextWriter

A TextWriter that captures the output from the response.

Exceptions
HttpException

The appVirtualDir parameter cannot be overridden in this context.

Properties

MachineConfigPath

Gets the full physical path to the Machine.config file.

public override string MachineConfigPath { get; }
Value
String

The physical path to the Machine.config file.

MachineInstallDirectory

Gets the physical path to the directory where the ASP.NET binaries are installed.

public override string MachineInstallDirectory { get; }
Value
String

The physical directory to the ASP.NET binary files.

RootWebConfigPath

Gets the full physical path to the root Web.config file.

public override string RootWebConfigPath { get; }
Value
String

The physical path to the root Web.config file.

Methods

EndOfRequest()

Notifies the HttpWorkerRequest that request processing for the current request is complete.

public override void EndOfRequest ();

FlushResponse(Boolean)

Sends all pending response data to the client.

public override void FlushResponse (bool finalFlush);
finalFlush
Boolean

true if this is the last time response data will be flushed; otherwise, false.

GetAppPath()

Returns the virtual path to the currently executing server application.

public override string GetAppPath ();
Returns
String

The virtual path of the current application.

GetAppPathTranslated()

Returns the UNC-translated path to the currently executing server application.

public override string GetAppPathTranslated ();
Returns
String

The physical path of the current application.

GetFilePath()

Returns the physical path to the requested URI.

public override string GetFilePath ();
Returns
String

The physical path to the requested URI.

GetFilePathTranslated()

Returns the physical file path to the requested URI (and translates it from virtual path to physical path: for example, "/proj1/page.aspx" to "c:\dir\page.aspx")

public override string GetFilePathTranslated ();
Returns
String

The translated physical file path to the requested URI.

GetHttpVerbName()

Returns the HTTP request verb.

public override string GetHttpVerbName ();
Returns
String

The HTTP verb for this request.

GetHttpVersion()

Returns the HTTP version string of the request (for example, "HTTP/1.1").

public override string GetHttpVersion ();
Returns
String

The HTTP version string returned in the request header.

GetLocalAddress()

Returns the server IP address of the interface on which the request was received.

public override string GetLocalAddress ();
Returns
String

The server IP address of the interface on which the request was received.

GetLocalPort()

Returns the port number on which the request was received.

public override int GetLocalPort ();
Returns
Int32

The server port number on which the request was received.

GetPathInfo()

Returns additional path information for a resource with a URL extension. That is, for the path /virdir/page.html/tail, the return value is /tail.

public override string GetPathInfo ();
Returns
String

Additional path information for a resource.

GetQueryString()

Returns the query string specified in the request URL.

public override string GetQueryString ();
Returns
String

The request query string.

GetRawUrl()

Returns the URL path contained in the header with the query string appended.

public override string GetRawUrl ();
Returns
String

The raw URL path of the request header.


The returned URL is not normalized. Using the URL for access control, or security-sensitive decisions can expose your application to canonicalization security vulnerabilities.

GetRemoteAddress()

Returns the IP address of the client.

public override string GetRemoteAddress ();
Returns
String

The client's IP address.

GetRemotePort()

Returns the client's port number.

public override int GetRemotePort ();
Returns
Int32

The client's port number.

GetServerVariable(String)

Returns a single server variable from a dictionary of server variables associated with the request.

public override string GetServerVariable (string name);
name
String

The name of the requested server variable.

Returns
String

The requested server variable.

GetUriPath()

Returns the virtual path to the requested URI.

public override string GetUriPath ();
Returns
String

The path to the requested URI.

GetUserToken()

Returns the client's impersonation token.

public override IntPtr GetUserToken ();
Returns
IntPtr

A value representing the client's impersonation token. The default is IntPtr.

MapPath(String)

Returns the physical path corresponding to the specified virtual path.

public override string MapPath (string path);
path
String

The virtual path.

Returns
String

The physical path that corresponds to the virtual path specified in the path parameter.

SendKnownResponseHeader(Int32,String)

Adds a standard HTTP header to the response.

public override void SendKnownResponseHeader (int index, string value);
index
Int32

The header index. For example, HeaderContentLength.

value
String

The header value.

SendResponseFromFile(IntPtr,Int64,Int64)

Adds the contents of the file with the specified handle to the response and specifies the starting position in the file and the number of bytes to send.

public override void SendResponseFromFile (IntPtr handle, long offset, long length);
handle
IntPtr

The handle of the file to send.

offset
Int64

The starting position in the file.

length
Int64

The number of bytes to send.

SendResponseFromFile(String,Int64,Int64)

Adds the contents of the file with the specified name to the response and specifies the starting position in the file and the number of bytes to send.

public override void SendResponseFromFile (string filename, long offset, long length);
filename
String

The name of the file to send.

offset
Int64

The starting position in the file.

length
Int64

The number of bytes to send.

SendResponseFromMemory(Byte[],Int32)

Adds the contents of a byte array to the response and specifies the number of bytes to send.

public override void SendResponseFromMemory (byte[] data, int length);
data
Byte[]

The byte array to send.

length
Int32

The number of bytes to send.

SendStatus(Int32,String)

Specifies the HTTP status code and status description of the response; for example, SendStatus(200, "Ok").

public override void SendStatus (int statusCode, string statusDescription);
statusCode
Int32

The status code to send

statusDescription
String

The status description to send.

SendUnknownResponseHeader(String,String)

Adds a nonstandard HTTP header to the response.

public override void SendUnknownResponseHeader (string name, string value);
name
String

The name of the header to send.

value
String

The value of the header.
